column4: anyone familiar with pam.d?   http://pastebin.com/d90b561f   this is /etc/pam.d/common-password   which (I believe) ubuntu uses to check login creds....    following some instructions for LDAP client setup,  I used auth-client-config to change it...  is there something wrong with this code?  anyone familiar with pam?
I setup sambaldap a few times using pam.d
you want samble files
I'm getting denied on my (correct) password ever since loading that...  I'm going to try putting it back,  but do you think that syntax is correct
I'm trying to make ubuntu a part of an AD network at work (if all works out)
?  I think I missed the syntax
http://pastebin.com/d90b561f
o
!mount
it looks ok to me, but mine is a little different
if you look on line 24, thats what used to be there
the only difference is that obscure is not listed
which shouldn't be a probelm right?
I got mine working from following how-to... so my understanding is limited... but my home network is running with ldap.
can you point me to one that you used?
my  common-password     password   sufficient pam_ldap.so md5         password   required   pam_unix.so md5 try_first_pass
sure... let me dig it up
was written for debian sarge, but it works for debian etch    http://nomis52.net/?section=docs&page=samldap
I'm going to try following your basic syntax,  thansk for your help
I had to change a lot of pam files... not just that one.. so your problem maybe elsewhere
that howto should sort it out though
i will look at that too, thanks
the nsswitch.conf is what has given me problems in the past.
I'll me on line for a while longer... I'll be happy to give you sample files if you need them....
